definition.value: Colorectal cancer.

short.value: The subject of the report, usually, but not always, the patient

definition.value: The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the investigation.

comments.value: This is not necessarily the source of the atomic data items - it is the entity that takes responsibility for the clinical report.

requirements.value: Need to know whom to contact if there are queries about the results. Also may need to track the source of reports for secondary data analysis.

valueString.value: 3 in cassette 1 4 in cassette 2 7 in cassette 3
1 in cassette 1 4 in cassette 2 3 in cassette 3

21 in total. A11 – 1 node, serially sliced A12 – 1 node, serially sliced A13 – 1 node, serially sliced A14 – 1 node, serially sliced A15 – 1 node, apical node, bisected and entirely submitted. A16 – 3 nodes A17 – 3 nodes A18 – 3 nodes A19 – 6 nodes, 1 bisected B - Mesentric lymph node Bisected and entirely submitted in 1 block

short.value: Number of lymph nodes in each cassette

definition.value: The number of lymph nodes placed in each cassette should be recorded.

comments.value: The RCPA require the following be recorded: "Numeric: ___ in cassette: ___" Query how to record this?

definition.value: The presence or absence of polyps should be recorded.

requirements.value: Conditional: If present, provide a polyp summary.

human.value: If polyps are present, provide a polyp summary.

description.value: A code that indicates the presence or absence of polyp(s)

short.value: The number, diameter and gross configuration of polyps should be summarised

definition.value: The polyp summary should include the numbers, diameter range and gross appearance.

valueString.value: Tumour appears ulcerated and scarred. Overlying serosa appears normal. Extramuscular spread to 15mm
Tumour appears plaquelike, remaining mucosa appears normal.

A segment of large bowel 175mm in length with an internal diameter of up to 52mm. The bowel has been opened prior to receipt. The peritoneal reflection has not been included in the specimen. Arising at 45mm from the presumed distal margin, a raised ulcerated firm tan tumour is present measuring 55x32mm. On slicing the tumour measures up to 10mm in thickness and infiltrates into the mesocolic fat. On the antimesenteric border, the tumour abuts the serosal surface. Tumour perforation is not seen. No other lesions are identified within the mucosa elsewhere. Blocks 1, 2 - reps of tumour with mesocolic fat. Blocks 3,4,5 - tumour with peritoneal surface. Block 6 - distal resection margin. Block 7 - apical lymph node. Block 8 - one lymph node. Block 9 - four lymph nodes. Block 10 - five lymph nodes. PP. (TW.LD)
Additional small polyps, 1-4mm in diameter, 4 within the c=vicinity of the tumour, 6 proximal to the tumour.
Pedunculated polyp 8mm, situated 55mm proximal to tumour.

definition.value: A descriptive or narrative field should be provided to record any macroscopic information that is not recorded in the above standards and guidelines, and that would normally form part of the macroscopic description.

valueString.value: Blocks 1 to 6: tumour. Block 7: distal margin. Blocks 8 & 9 : circumferential margin. Blocks 10 to 16: 14 lymph nodes (2 in each block).
Blocks 1: shaved vascular margin, 2 to 4: tumour with greatest depth of invasion, radial inked red, distal inked blue. 5 – tumour with adjacent mucosa. 6-9 lymph nodes

A1-A2 - Omentum. A3 - Ileal margin with adjacent noninvolved ileum. A4 - Appendix with base painted. A5-A6 - Tumour at ileocaecal junction. A7-A8 - Representative sections of tumour. A9 - Tumour with nonperitonealised margin. A10 - Ascending colon and distal resection margin. Lymph nodes as above

definition.value: The nature and sites of all blocks must be recorded.
Microscopy of the sample.

High grade, variable differentiation, predominantly moderate but areas of poor differentiation. Microsatellite stable (IHC)

pT3 Tumour invades through muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues
pT3, tumour invades through full thickness of muscularis propria.

valueString.value: The submucosal nodule 20mm from the distal margin is a well differentiated carcinoid tumour, completely excised.
The submucosal nodule 20mm from the distal margin is a well differentiated carcinoid tumour, completely excised.

The caecal tumour is an adenocarcinoma, formed by malignant epithelial cells forming branching glands, some with cribriform pattern. These cells have pleomorphic nuclei with prominent nucleoli. Maximum distance of spread beyond muscularis propria: 5 mm.

valueString.value: Immunohistochemistry for mismatch repair gene products: staining of carcinoma cells for MLH-1, PMS-2, MSH-2 and MSH-6 is present.
Mismatch repair gene deficiency NOT identified
High-level microsatellite instability (MSI-H) is very unlikely.
High-level microsatellite instability (MSI-H) is very unlikely.
Preserved nuclear staining for mismatch repair proteins MLH1, PMS2, MSH2 and MSH6 indicates a low likelihood of microsatellite instability phenotype.

There is strong nuclear staining (normal pattern) ini only a minor component of the residual tumour (block 1C) and attenuated (MSH2) or loss (MSH6) to staining in the rest. Whilst this abnormal staining pattern is likely to be secondary to the neoadjuvant therapy, thurther investigation to exclude germline mutation in MSH2 and MSH6 should be considered.
High-level microsatellite instability (MSI-H) is very unlikely.

valueString.value: Low rectal tumour, ultralow anterior resection with proximal and distal donuts: - Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, invading into perirectal fat. - Less than 1mm from circumferential radial margin. - Proximal and distal margins free of tumour. - 8 lymph nodes, all benign. - No MSI loss detected by immunohistochemistry.

Diagnostic Summary: Specimen type: Abdominoperineal resection Tumour site: Distal rectum, 35mm below anterior peritoneal reflection, 12 mm above dentate line. Tumour type: Low grade adenocarcinoma NOS, microsatellite stable (IHC) Tumour stage: pT2N1aMX, stage IIIA Completeness of excision: R0
Diagnosis: Abdominoperineal resection, distal rectum - low grade adenocarcinoma NOS, 30mm, microsatellite stable (IHC)
Lymph nodes - +1/41, metastatic carcinoma in one of forty-one nodes, apical node clear
TNM class AJCC stage (7th) - pT2N1aMX, stage IIIA, R0
Polyps - Hyperplastic polyps x9 (<5mm)

Diagnostic Summary: Specimen type: Ultra-low anterior resection Tumour site: Rectum Tumour type: Adenocarcinoma, poorly differentiated tumour budding Tumour stage: pT3N0 cM, stage IIA Completeness of excision: Complete
Diagnosis: 1. Rectum and Sigmoid, ultrlow anterior resection: - Adenocarcinoma NOS, 30x28x15mm, poorly differentiated tumour budding, focal extramural venous invasion. - radial clearance 5mm, distal clearance 12mm. Lymph nodes: 0/36; thirty-six benign lymph nodes. TNM class, AJCC stage (7th): pT3N0 cM0, stage IIA, R0 Polyp, upper rectum: Tubulovillous adenoma, 8mm. 2. Distal donut: No evidence of malignancy

Diagnostic Summary: Specimen type:High anterior resection Tumour site: Rectum-sigmoid colon Tumour type: Adenocarcinoma Tumour stage: pT3. n0, Mx, R0 Completeness of excision: Completely excised
Diagnosis: 1. Anterior resection: - Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, recto-sigmoid, completely excised. - Focus suspicious for lymphovascular invasion - no evidence of malignancy in thirteen lymph nodes (0/13) - pT3, n0, MX, R0, stage IIA (Dukes stage B) 2. Distal donut - No evidence of malignancy 3. Proximal donut - No evidence of malignancy

Diagnostic Summary: Specimen type:Anterior resection Tumour site: Upper rectum 300mm above level of anterior peritoneal reflection Tumour type: Adenocarcinoma NOS Low grade (post therapy) microsatellite stable Tumour stage: ypT3 N1b cMx cM0; stage IIIB Completeness of excision: R0
Diagnosis: 1. Upper rectum: Upper rectum - Redidual adenocarcinoma NOS, minimal response to therapy (TRG 2) - Extramural venous invasion Lymph nodes - +2/23; metastatic carcinoma in two of twenty-three nodes, treatment related changes in additional three nodes, apical node clear. TNM class AJCC Stage (7th) - ypT3N1b cM0; stage IIIB; R0 MMR IHC - Pending, supplementary report to follow 2. Distal rectal donut - No evidence of malignancy

Diagnostic Summary: Specimen type:Low anterior resection Tumour site: Rectum Tumour type: Adenocarcinoma NOS, microsatellite stable, variable differentiation including poorly differentiated areas Tumour stage: pT3cN2aMx; stage IIIB Completeness of excision: R0
Diagnosis: 1. Low anterior resection rectum: - High grade adenocarcinoma NOS, 30x25mm, microsatellite stable - Venous invasion, lymphatic permeation and perineural invasion present Lymph nodes - +4/16; metastatic carcinoma in four of sixteen nodes - Apical node involved - extranural satellite deposits x2. TNM class AJCC Stage (7th) - pT3cN2aMX; stage IIIB; R0 2. Proximal donut - Benign colonic tissue 3. Distal donut - Benign rectal tissue

definition.value: Diagnostic summary is to be recorded.

requirements.value: Include: a. specimen type b. tumour site c. tumour type d. tumour stage e. completeness of excision.

valueString.value: Mismatch repair gene deficiency is not identified.

definition.value: Synthesis and overview overarching comment.
